page.title: 17WATER
page.content: There are many springs and small streams in the area. Eventually these feed the River Holme.The water is very soft due to the peat on moors: that is why the textile industry grew up here. Each mill had its own dam. Dobroyd still has two which are now trout ponds.The local water is also well suited to brewing beer. Water is supplied to houses from two main reservoirs Broadstone and Holmstyes. Some houses have wells in their cellars.A tunnel runs from Broadstone towards Hepworth Iron Company and was built in the 1850s. Horse troughs collecting spring water are common. Hepworth has public wells where women used to wash clothes.There is a covered reservoir near Rusby Wood. Farms and cottages in outlying areas have septic tank sewage disposal.
